DOC.brief_summary: To assess the effect of a breakfast (40 g fat) on single dose pharmacokinetics of a 2.5 mg BIBB 515 dose in capsules as well as the tolerability of BIBB 515 BS capsules
DOC.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of BIBB 515 BS and Effect of Food After Oral Administration in Healthy Subjects
DOC.criteria: Healthy male caucasian subjects as determined by results of screening Written informed consent in accordance with good clinical practice (GCP) and local legislation Age ≥ 18 and ≤ 50 years Broca ≥ 20 % and ≤ + 20 % Any finding of the medical examination (including blood pressure, pulse rate and ECG) deviating from normal and of clinical relevance Gastrointestinal, hepatic, renal, respiratory, cardiovascular, metabolic, immunological or hormonal disorders Surgery of gastrointestinal tract (except appendectomy) Diseases of the central nervous system (such as epilepsy) or psychiatric disorders or neurologic disorders History of orthostatic hypotension, fainting spells or blackouts Chronic or relevant acute infections History of allergy/hypersensitivity (including drug allergy) which is deemed relevant to the trial as judged by the investigator Intake of drugs with a long halflife (> 24 hours) (≤ 1 month prior to administration or during the trial) Use of any drugs which might influence the results of the trial (≤ 10 days prior to administration or during the trial) Participation in another trial with an investigational drug (≤ 2 months prior to administration or during the trial) Smoker (> 10 cigarettes or > 3 cigars or > 3 pipes/day) Inability to refrain from smoking on study days Alcohol abuse (> 60 g/day) Drug abuse Blood donation > 100 ml (≤ 4 weeks prior to administration or during the trial) Excessive physical activities (≤ 10 days prior to administration or during the trial) Any laboratory value outside the reference range of clinical relevance
